benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/children - List children accounts

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC06, TC19, TC20) verify successful retrieval with default and various query-parameter combinations (accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit levels).
Empty Response: TC07 and TC24 validate behavior when a parent has no children or when children were deleted (empty JSON array with 200).
Query Parameters: Good breadth — valid combinations (TC06), malformed values (TC16), unexpected extra params ignored (TC13).
Path Parameter Validation: TC09 covers invalid UUID format (400); TC10 and TC08 cover parent-not-found (404).
Authorization: TC11 and TC12 cover unauthenticated (401) and unauthorized (403) cases.

Error Conditions & Resilience: Dependency/service down (TC14 -> 503), timeout (TC18 -> 504), injection attempts (TC17 -> 400), malformed inputs (TC16), large data volume/performance (TC15), regression and integration checks (TC19, TC22).
Concurrency and data consistency: TC21 (concurrent access), TC23 (reflects newly created child) cover runtime consistency aspects.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination (page/limit/offset) or how the endpoint behaves when results must be paged — the standard guidelines explicitly call out pagination for GET with large datasets. TC15 checks large volume but expects all 10,000 returned rather than verifying paging behavior or limits.
Caching Behavior / HTTP Headers: No scenarios assert caching or conditional request headers (ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control) or behavior for 304 Not Modified.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests exercise multiple rapid requests to validate rate limiting or 429 responses.
Content-Type and Response Headers: Tests do not assert response Content-Type (application/json) nor other relevant headers (e.g., pagination-related Link headers, request-id).
Response Schema Validation: No explicit tests validate that each Account object matches the published Account schema/field types (beyond presence/absence of balance/CBA/audit).
Invalid enum/query values for audit: No test for invalid audit enum values (e.g., audit=INVALID) to ensure 400 handling.

Mutual exclusion / semantic conflicts between query params: While combinations are tested, there is no explicit test documenting the system behavior when conflicting parameters are provided or precedence rules (if any).

Partial/malformed path cases beyond UUID: Only a missing accountId path leads to 404 (TC25), but there is no test for trailing slashes, additional path segments, or method-not-allowed (e.g., POST/PUT on this endpoint).
Rate/Load performance boundaries: TC15 asserts a performance threshold for 10,000 records but does not cover paged retrieval performance or server resource utilization under sustained load.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include scenarios for page/offset/limit parameters, verify Link or pagination headers (if used), and verify behavior when requesting pages beyond available data.
Add caching/conditional request tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, behavior for If-None-Match returning 304, and that responses include correct caching headers.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: simulate multiple rapid requests to validate 429 responses or headers like Retry-After and confirm graceful degradation.
Add response header and content-type assertions: ensure responses have Content-Type: application/json and any relevant headers (request-id, correlation-id, Link for pagination).
Add strict schema validation tests: verify Account object fields, types and required fields match the API schema definition (not just presence of balance/CBA/audit).
Add tests for invalid audit enum values: ensure audit parameter validation returns 400 for unknown enum values and documents expected error message.
Test semantic/edge cases for combined query params: specify expected behavior when conflicting parameters are present and add tests for precedence/validation rules.
Add method-not-allowed tests: validate that non-GET methods on this path return 405 as appropriate.
Expand performance/load tests: include paged large-data performance, sustained load patterns, and resource usage thresholds rather than a single large-request perf assertion.
